alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Monroe; Summers; Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 25 at 4:17AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Gusty Winds Expected Today... Southwesterly winds, gusting up to 25 to 35 mph at times, are expected today. Higher elevations, such as the West Virginia and Virginia Highlands, and isolated ridge tops, such as Pilot and Sauratown Mountain in North Carolina, could experience wind gusts around 40 mph. Exercise caution while driving on area roadways, especially if operating high profile vehicles on the interstates. Be sure to secure outdoor objects, including trash cans and inflatable Christmas decorations. There is a wind advisory for the highest elevations of far southwestern Virginia, and the High Country of North Carolina. Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph are possible at elevations above 4000 feet, which includes places like the Grayson Highlands, Mount Rogers, Mount Jefferson, and Beech Mountain.
